## bio

i’m a postdoc at arizona state university with a strong foundation in scientometrics and data analysis that began in granada (spain) with a solid predoctoral experience. i’ve published numerous articles in leading scientometrics journals and regularly review papers. i’ve been involved in various research and educational projects, and i’ve also focused on knowledge transfer as the coo of the ec3metrics spin-off. i’ve also organized and taught courses both nationally and internationally, contributing to initiatives like the european summer school of scientometrics and #yosigougr.

## research focus & key contributions

• **big data & large-scale informetric analysis**<br>my main contribution has been processing and generating an open knowledge graph of wikipedia

• **altmetrics & mapping social media**<br>i’ve mapped engagement around science on twitter

• **new methods in science communication**<br>i developed a proposal to identify and quantify the impact of twitter bots on scientific discussions

• **research evaluation**<br>i’ve contributed to the development of narrative bibliometrics

• **applications of generative ai in academia**<br>i’ve helped integrate ai into academia through manuals and guides
